Sentencas: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation of reformed gases were investigated at the well defined Ni-mesh/oxide interfaces in mu m level.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: The effective reaction areas were determined by isotope labeling technique under the mixture of CH4, D2O, and O-18(2) at 1073 K.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: A deposition of carbon preferentially occurred on the Ni-mesh surface on Y2O3-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ) and SM2O3-doped CeO2 (SDC) electrolyte oxides.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: A slight reduction of carbon deposition was observed on SDC substrate under non-polarized condition.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: The electronic and structural properties changes of Ni were observed by XANES/EXAFS analysis.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: By anodic polarization, a significant reduction of deposited carbon was observed on Ni-mesh surface in Ni-mesh/YSZ and Ni-mesh/SDC samples.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: Oxygen spill over can be effective for eliminating the deposited carbon on the Ni-mesh.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry

Sentencas: Hydrogen and isotope oxygen concentration (O-18(2)) on the Ni-mesh was changed by the oxide substrates under anodic polarization.
Titulo: Active parts for CH4 decomposition and electrochemical oxidation at metal/oxide interfaces by isotope labeling-secondary ion mass spectrometry
